EPFL developed tech makes it to the International Space Station

  • News
  • EPFL
Read moresur Tech Transfer.

The U.S. start-up Cryptosat has taken the EPFL developed Drand protocol, the internet’s first production grade, publicly verifiable randomness beacon, into space for an historic experiment.

Read more

“The West now realizes it has taken some things for granted”

23.03.22NewsEPFL

Yves Daccord, who served as the director-general of the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) from 2010 to 2020, has just joined EPFL’s EssentialTech Centre as a senior advisor. In this interview, he explains how he will draw on his knowledge and contacts to help the Centre set ambitious objectives as it enters its second decade.

Innovative arthritis treatment combines heat with exercise

22.03.22NewsEPFL

EPFL engineers have discovered that increasing the temperature of cartilage in the knee during physical exertion could prevent the cartilage from degenerating.

All news

Natural Machines

Read the full story

The robots, machines and smart systems that human beings have developed over the centuries – and with particular fervor in recent decades – have almost always been inspired by nature.

Read the full story

Profiles

Intense press coverage prompts new expeditions to Dyatlov Pass

24.03.22Research

In 2021, professors Johan Gaume from EPFL and Alexander Puzrin from ETH Zurich conducted a study that attempted to explain the gruesome fate which befell a group of hikers in the Ural Mountains. The press coverage of their findings was so intense that it had significant impact on their lives and prompted further expeditions to Dyatlov Pass, which confirmed the occurrence of avalanches.

EPFL gets a student association for blockchain enthusiasts

23.03.22EPFL community

EPFL’s Blockchain Student Association is working with the Junior Enterprise team to develop a training program on building decentralized blockchain applications.

"Management is facing major changes to an extent never seen before"

16.02.22Research

The Academy of Management Journal announced that EPFL Professor Marc Gruber would become its Editor-in-Chief in 2022. This is the first time a scholar with a European-based PhD has been appointed to this position, and only the second time that the editorship for the journal is based at a European institution.

View all profile articles

Located in Switzerland, EPFL is one of Europe’s most vibrant and cosmopolitan science and technology institutions.
